decks.notes: This UR Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Surgical Extraction to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck seeks to maintain pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their strategy, ultimately aiming to win the game quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells, removal spells like Fatal Push, and disruptive creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog. It also utilizes card advantage and card selection tools like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Preordain to maintain control over the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gradually gaining advantages and eventually overpowering them with powerful threats like Wan Shi Tong, Librarian and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to capitalize on aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride to deal early damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory to enhance the creatures and provide additional support. Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge provide removal options, while Blood Moon can disrupt opponent's mana base. The deck aims to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent with efficient and fast creatures, while also having some control elements with Thraben Charm and Arena of Glory.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a mixture of powerful creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on early creature aggro with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, supported by burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for attacks. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional buffs and support, while Static Prison and Elegant Parlor help control the opponent's board. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game quickly.

This deck focuses on assembling the Allosaurus Rider combo using cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to quickly search for key pieces like Griselbrand or Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. The deck also includes cards like Planar Genesis and Generous Ent to ramp up mana quickly and overrun the opponent. Consign to Memory and Pact of Negation provide protection against disruption, while cards like Disciple of Freyalise and Atraxa, Grand Unifier help support the combo strategy. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent in the early game.

This deck revolves around using aggressive creatures to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with removal spells and hand disruption. The deck includes powerful creatures like Solitude, Overlord of the Balemurk, and Emperor of Bones, as well as disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler. By combining aggression with disruption, this deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot and take control of the game. Additionally, cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp provide additional value and synergies with the deck's creatures.

The main idea of this Modern Combo - Hammer Time deck is to quickly equip creatures with powerful equipment such as Colossus Hammer and Leyline Axe, while generating card advantage and mana with Puresteel Paladin and Mox Opal. The deck utilizes cards like Urza's Saga and Stoneforge Mystic to find the necessary pieces, while also including ways to protect the creatures like Shadowspear and Esper Sentinel. With the ability to quickly assemble a lethal threat, this deck aims to win the game through aggressive attacks and combo interactions.

The main idea of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Ruby Medallion and Manamorphose, then cast big spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames to generate a large storm count. By reducing the cost of spells and casting multiple spells in a turn, the player can create a lethal Grapeshot or generate a large amount of mana through rituals and play their entire deck, finishing off the opponent in one explosive turn. The deck focuses on efficiency and speed to overwhelm the opponent before they can react.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy that aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure on the board. It utilizes a combination of cheap removal spells, disruptive creatures, and flicker effects to control the game tempo. The deck also includes a mix of powerful threats and card advantage engines to maintain a strong board presence and outvalue the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to quickly close out games through a combination of disruption, tempo plays, and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to quickly bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes cards like Faithful Mending and Consign to Memory to help filter through the deck and find key combo pieces. Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation provide disruption against opposing strategies, while cards like Solitude and Prismatic Ending offer removal options. Ephemerate and March of Otherworldly Light can help protect key creatures or reanimate them multiple times in a turn. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on deploying aggressive creatures quickly and efficiently to deal damage to the opponent, utilizing a mix of red, green, and white cards for versatility. Each card in the deck contributes to the overall strategy of overwhelming the opponent with early threats and maintaining pressure throughout the game. It also includes disruptive spells and enchantments to control the board and protect its creatures. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace and outpace the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing various artifacts and legendary creatures to create a powerful combo engine. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Kethis, the Hidden Hand work together to recur key artifacts from the graveyard, while Urza's Saga and Mox Amber help ramp up mana production. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Jace, the Perfected Mind provide card draw and control elements. Grinding Station and Malevolent Rumble serve as win conditions by milling out the opponent. The deck also includes disruption tools like Teferi, Time Raveler and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect the combo pieces.

This UW Control deck focuses on disruptive spells and controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The main strategy is to use cards like Terminus, Counterspell, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Solitude to disrupt your opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage with cards like Opt, Telling Time, and Meticulous Archive. The deck also includes a companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, for additional value. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent until it can win the game with powerful threats like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Hall of Storm Giants.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays using cards with a mix of colors, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu to deal damage quickly. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help control the board while cards like Lightning Bolt provide direct damage to opponents. The deck also includes cards like Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury for powerful threats. Stubborn Denial offers protection against removal spells, while cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Prismatic Ending provide additional utility. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient creatures and versatile spells.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures to ramp into big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths while also controlling the board with cards like Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return. It uses cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to ramp up quickly, and disrupts the opponent's game plan with Chalice of the Void and Ghost Quarter. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and control elements, while using Eldrazi Temple and Ugin's Labyrinth to generate extra value.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on quick and efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Seasoned Pyromancer, while also utilizing burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to deal direct damage to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Thraben Charm provide additional support and utility to ensure consistent pressure on the opponent. This deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently through a combination of creature aggression and burn damage.
